0: China's annual Spring Festival travel rush never really gets truly started until tens of thousands of travelers are stranded together inside a single railway station for hours on end. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Such was the case last night, when rare snow in parts of eastern and central Chinese caused the delay of some trains, sending travelers spiraling into total hell. At the always hellish Guangzhou Railway Station, around 100,000 people waited outside for their train to finally come in. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR For the historic occasion, local police were forced to draft 1,300 extra security personnel when the initial 2,600 officers just weren't enough to handle the constantly surging crowd. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Check out all the fun: NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Of course, migrants in Guangzhou weren't the only ones suffering.
